CatDescriptText: Jasper Campbell, laborer, Fifth Ward and Clarence Furcorn, laborer, 15th Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 6, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Which of these reasons do you believe is the cause of many citizens not voting: (1) Belief that 'political machine-backed' candidates are hard to defeat? (2) Lack of interest in who runs their government?" Mr. Campbell's answer reads: "The first one, because the people in office are the ones who have the jobs and hand out the 'gravy'...A possible solution is for people to back independent candidates, like Atty. Henry R. Smith Jr., and arouse the voters."  Mr. Furcorn's answer reads: "Lack of interest...A lot of people, when you talk to them, will say, 'What's the use of voting because my vote is not going to count--because they are going to do what they want..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Jasper Campbell wearing fedora, eyeglasses, triangle patterned necktie with geometric clip, light colored jacket, and dark coat, standing on Wood Street, Downtown; Portrait of Clarence Furcorn wearing fedora, floral shirt, and light colored coat, standing on Wood Street, Downtown
